course_title: Applied evidence and clinical reasoning in musculoskeletal physiotherapy practice

learning_outcomes.description: Critically appraise the biological and behavioural sciences of musculoskeletal pain, injury and health.
Discuss the physiological and behavioural basis for physiotherapy management of musculoskeletal pain, injury and health.
Critically appraise models on mechanisms, pathogenesis and management of musculoskeletal disorders.
Understand the role of the multi-disciplinary team in the management of musculoskeletal pain, injury and health.
Clearly and effectively synthesize and communicate evidence-informed practice understanding and recommendations for managing musculoskeletal pain, injury and health to discipline experts.

assessments.task_description:
You will be required to demonstrate the ability to contribute to and work as part of a team with a common professional purpose. This will include planning and preparation, communication, contribution and active participation in all aspects of the problem/case based scenario learning series.

This is a pass/fail component and must be passed in order to achieve a passing grade in the course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.assessment_title: Problem-Based Learning Viva Exams: Upper quadrant
assessments.task_description:
For the two problem-based/case-scenario learning activities on the upper quadrant, you will be given a case scenario to work on as a group(s) over a 2-week period. A tutor will facilitate group learning. You will then present your response as a group in the form of a seminar to an expert on the following dates:

Upper limb - Friday 8th August

Cervical spine - Friday 29th August

Following each seminar there will be a VIVA Voce (oral exam). This exam will be at least 2 days after the seminar, during which time you will reflect upon your learning, and your clinical practice. For the VIVA Voce you will receive 10 minutes perusal time and then a 10-minute oral exam. There will be 1 VIVA Voce for each of the 4 problem-based/case scenarios. Each VIVA Voce is weighted 17.5% of the total course. The VIVA Voce are scheduled on the following dates:

Upper limb VIVA Voce - Monday 11th August

Cervical spine VIVA Voce - Monday 1st September

Online VIVAs will be recorded and retained (as per UQ policy https://policies.uq.edu.au/document/view-current.php?id=184).

This assessment task is to be completed live online. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.assessment_title: Problem-Based Learning Viva Exams: Lower quadrant

For the two problem-based/case-scenario learning activities on the lower quadrant, you will be given a case scenario to work on as a group(s) over a 2-week period. A tutor will facilitate group learning. You will then present your response as a group in the form of a seminar to an expert on the following dates:

Following each seminar there will be a VIVA Voce (oral exam). This exam will be at least 2 days after the seminar, during which time you will reflect upon your learning, and your clinical practice. For the VIVA Voce you will receive 10 minutes perusal time and then a 10-minute oral exam. There will be 1 VIVA Voce for each of the 4 problem-based/case scenarios. Each VIVA Voce is weighted 17.5% of the total course. The VIVA Voce are scheduled on the following dates:

Lower limb VIVA Voce - Monday 22nd September

Lumbar spine VIVA Voce - Monday 20th October

Online VIVAs will be recorded and retained (as per UQ policy https://policies.uq.edu.au/document/view-current.php?id=184).

This assessment task is to be completed live online. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
Students will deliver an individual presentation at a Musculoskeletal and Sports Physiotherapy Conference Day at the end of semester. The conference will be open to the wider physiotherapy profession. The student will collaborate with the co-ordination team to select a conference topic to present.

Podium presentations will be recorded and retained (as per UQ policy https://policies.uq.edu.au/document/view-current.php?id=184).

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.Â
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 12(28 Jul - 26 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Problems-based/case-scenario learning seminars

There will be 4 problems-based/case-scenario learning seminars, each with an associated Viva Voce. You will work as a group to address a case scenario and present your findings to an expert.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Problems-based/case-scenario learning seminars There will be 4 problems-based/case-scenario learning seminars, each with an associated Viva Voce. You will work as a group to address a case scenario and present your findings to an expert.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 9 To Revision week(22 Sep - 09 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Podium presentation feedback sessions

Staff will facilitate sessions to provide feedback on the progress of your podium presentation. During these sessions you will receive feedback on your planning and development of your podium presentation from staff and your peers. You are also expected to provide feedback to your peers on their planning and development of their presentations.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
